title: Klopp thought matching Man City's winning-streak record was impossible
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he "never thought it was possible" for his side to equal Manchester City's record of 18 consecutive Premier League wins after they beat West Ham 3-2.

title: Tearful tributes at Kobe and Gianna Bryant service
description: Thousands attended a service for the NBA star and his daughter who died in a helicopter crash in January.

title: Yorkshire Tea 'shocked' by backlash over Rishi Sunak photo
description: The firm urges people to "try to be kind" after Tory minister's picture brews up a Twitter storm.

title: President Trump in India: Mispronunciations and cheers on day one
description: A crowded cricket stadium and tricky pronunciations marked the first day of the US president's trip.

title: World's most expensive sheepdog sells for £18k
description: Megan the border collie will leave her home in Northumberland to herd cattle in Oklahoma.

title: Can Chelsea stop Bayern Munich's 'outstanding' Robert Lewandowski?
description: Football experts from around Europe give the continental view on Tuesday's Champions League last-16 ties, with Chelsea hosting Bayern Munich, and Barcelona visiting Napoli.

title: Coronavirus: Rapid spread raises fears of global pandemic
description: More infections are reported around the world as governments struggle to contain outbreaks.

title: Flood levels in Shrewsbury could be 'highest ever'
description: Main roads in and around Shrewsbury are closed and severe floods could seal off the town.

title: Children banned from heading footballs during training
description: The training guidelines are effective immediately but do not recommend a heading ban during matches.

title: Canary Islands sandstorm: Flights disrupted as dust cloud strands tourists
description: Flights to and from the Spanish islands have been disrupted, leaving tourists stranded at airports.

title: Ospreys and Ulster games in Italy postponed because of Coronavirus fears
description: Ospreys and Ulster's Pro14 trips to play in Italy at the weekend are postponed as sporting bodies react to the spread of coronavirus.

title: 'We are trapped in the house that killed our son'
description: Zane Gbangbola was poisoned during flooding at his home. But has the full story of his death been told?

title: Tesco to sell plasters in racially diverse skin tones
description: The supermarket chain says it wants to give a better reflection of ethnic diversity.

title: Home Secretary Priti Patel 'deeply concerned' by 'false MI5 claims'
description: The home secretary hits back at reports of distrust from security bosses and bullying behaviour.

title: Love Island winner Finn Tapp expected back by Oxford City
description: Oxford City said Finn Tapp left without telling them in January to take part in Love Island.

title: Dementia: Does heading a football cause the disease?
description: Concerns are growing that heading a football may increase the risk of players developing dementia.

title: Hilary Mantel: Cromwell trilogy finale hailed as 'masterpiece' by critics
description: The Mirror and the Light concludes the Thomas Cromwell saga that began with Wolf Hall in 2009.

title: Australia survive scare to beat Sri Lanka at Women's T20 World Cup
description: Australia recover from being reduced to 10-3 to beat Sri Lanka by five wickets and claim their first win of the Women's T20 World Cup in Perth.

title: Your guide to housing in the UK
description: Your guide to housing in the UK and what can be done to satisfy the need for affordable and decent homes.

title: Samira Ahmed reaches settlement with BBC
description: The presenter won her employment tribunal last month against the corporation over equal pay.

title: Chelsea: Antonio Rudiger says 'racism won' after no evidence found to support abuse claim
description: Chelsea's Antonio Rudiger says he is "the scapegoat" after no evidence was found to support his allegation of abuse from fans at Tottenham.

title: Extinction: Meet the new poster animals of conservation
description: Scientists say charismatic but lesser-known "flagship species" are key to raising money for conservation.

title: Ilkeston NatWest Hole: TripAdvisor halts spoof reviews
description: A spate of spoof reviews saw the hole ranked as one of Ilkeston's top-rated attractions.

title: 'Police let me down after I reported being raped'
description: Lucy Monaghan waives her right to anonymity after decision is taken not to prosecute alleged attacker.

title: Syria conflict: Inside the final rebel stronghold
description: Millions of people who have long opposed the Syrian regime are trapped at the border with Turkey.

title: The Papers: Fury 'gypsy king of the world' and pandemic fears
description: Tyson Fury's boxing triumph and the latest coronavirus outbreaks dominate Monday's newspapers.

title: Hunters: Jewish groups criticise Holocaust portrayal in Amazon show
description: The drama series draws ire for a gruesome and fictitious human chess scene at Auschwitz.

title: Building surge hints at comeback of the council house
description: A recent surge in building by local authorities suggests the council house may be returning.

title: What Donald Trump gets out of his trip to India
description: The US president's first official trip to the world's largest democracy will be a photo-op and a half.

title: Rising number of middle-aged people still renting homes
description: Statistics show a big rise in the number of middle-aged people renting their homes, rather than owning them.

title: How Africa hopes to gain from the 'new scramble'
description: The continent's leaders have been globe-trotting to attend Africa-themed summits, but do they have a plan?

title: Public toilets: Should you be able to pee for free?
description: Toilet access in London can be a real issue for many people who live in and visit the city.

title: Earth Harp: The man behind the unique instruments 'epic' sound
description: The inventor of the world's longest string instrument explains its unique and majestic sound.

title: The boss putting an end to empty homes
description: Katharine Hibbert is the founder of UK property guardianship company Dot Dot Dot.

title: 'My journey to accept being a childless woman' in Niger
description: Filmmaker Aicha Macky from Niger is on a journey to determine her role in society as a childless woman.

title: Alberto Salazar's spectacular fall from grace
description: From helping Mo Farah become Britain's most successful track athlete in history, to appealing a four-year ban from athletics, BBC Panorama investigates Alberto Salazar's fall from grace.

title: New questions over Farah's relationship with Salazar
description: Fresh questions over Mo Farah's relationship with his disgraced former coach Alberto Salazar are raised in a new BBC Panorama investigation.

title: Kobe Bryant: How a basketball legend inspired young players
description: Three young basketballers from different corners of the world tell us how important Kobe Bryant was to them.
